results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: Telling tales
results.brief_description:
Telling Tales are real stories told and produced by people with a disability and those who are disadvantaged.

Telling Tales challenges the ‘norms’ as often represented by mainstream film with first person accounts that provide a real opportunity to be seen and heard. The stories explore personal journeys of identity, displacement, relationships, longing and memory.

Telling Tales was produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

group_works.title: Hopes and Dreams
group_works.creator_credit: Alex Litsoudis and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Hopes and Dreams
results.creator_credit: Alex Litsoudis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Alex tells of a horrifying abuse he suffered in his childhood that resulted in permanent effects on his life. Following his passion for drama, Alex co-founded the ‘Ability Bunch’.
results.description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. results.title: The Brown dressing gown
results.brief_description: Patric fondly remembers his social worker Julie Wilson who helped him come out of his cocoon and discard his brown dressing gown. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and The Deafness Foundation.

results.title: Brewing up a fairytale
results.creator_credit: Christine Evely and Glenferrie Primary School
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program “Brewing up a new Tale: a live action production workshop” for lower primary. Students interact with Green Screen Technology and fairytale sets to learn the basics of narrative contruction, genre and and scene.

results.title: Shorter cuts: Snatch and grab (3/11/04)
results.creator_credit: Annemaree O'Brien and Bayside Secondary College
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program. Students script and shoot scenes for an episode of Shorter Cuts, based on the TV series Short Cuts. Short Cuts was produced by Burberry Productions in Association with the Seven network and Film Victoria.

results.title: Shorter cuts: Snatch and grab (21/10/04)
results.creator_credit: Annemaree O'Brien and Bayside Secondary College
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program “Snatch and Grab: Shorter Cuts Episode”. In the program, Middle Year Students script and shoot scenes for an episode of Shorter Cuts, based on the Burberry Productions TV series Short Cuts. The program was developed in collaboration with Burberry Productions, with assistance from Film Victoria and Seven Network.
